edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.kohonen
Class KohonenSOM2D<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>

java.lang.Object
  edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AbstractClusteringMethod<T,C>
      edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.AbstractUnsupervisedOnlineClusteringMethod<T,KohonenSOMCell<T>>
          edu.berkeley.compbio.ml.cluster.kohonen.KohonenSOM2D<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
CentroidClusteringMethod<T>, ClusteringMethod<T>, ClusterList<T>, DiffusableLabelClusteringMethod<T,KohonenSOMCell<T>>, KohonenSOM<T>, OnlineClusteringMethod<T>, PrototypeBasedCentroidClusteringMethod<T>, SampleInitializedOnlineClusteringMethod<T>, SemisupervisedClusteringMethod<T>, SupervisedClusteringMethod<T>, UnsupervisedClusteringMethod<T>
public class KohonenSOM2D<T extends AdditiveClusterable<T>>
extends AbstractUnsupervisedOnlineClusteringMethod<T,KohonenSOMCell<T>>
implements KohonenSOM<T>

Kohonen Self Organizing Map implementation for a rectangular grid of two dimensions.

The standard algorithm moves the cells towards the winner cell; in our implementation we also have the option to remove the point from the cell where it was previously assigned, moving the neighbors away from the moved node a bit.

Note that because this is an "online" method, we can't do PCA or whatever to initialize the grid. That's OK; we'll just initialize the grid with a uniform prototype; after placing the first incoming point with a neighborhood encompassing the whole grid, all cells will be differentiated.

Version:
$Id$
Author:
David Soergel

add

public boolean add(T p)
            throws NoGoodClusterException
Description copied from interface: UnsupervisedClusteringMethod
Adds a point to the best cluster. Generally it's not a good idea to store the point itself in the cluster for memory reasons; so this method is primarily useful for updating the position of the centroid.
